title: Goodwood Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Pete Chapman / Goodwood Country Park, Eastern Car Park, West Sussex
images.caption: Goodwood Country Park, Eastern Car Park, September 2005. Goodwood Country Park is an area of public access land (owned by the Goodwood Estate) adjacent to the Goodwood Racecourse on top of the South Downs. The area is mainly broadleaf woodland, with two main grassy open spaces (this car park is one of them), one at the E of the area and one at the W. The country park has an extensive network of paths and, in places, offers views over towards the nearby city of Chichester.

images.title: Ben Shade (BenShade or see wikipedia BenShade) / CC BY-SA (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/)
images.caption: Timber stack on ride at Goodwood Estate. Cordwood destined for firewood stacked on rideside in beech woodland on the South Downs above Goodwood

images.title: David Saunders / Timber stack on ride at Goodwood Estate
images.caption: Timber stack on ride at Goodwood Estate. Cordwood destined for firewood stacked on rideside in beech woodland on the South Downs above Goodwood

images.title: Nigel Freeman / Goodwood Racecourse
images.caption: Goodwood Racecourse. A 'glorious' setting especially during Glorious Goodwood at the end of July

images.title: Simon Carey / Footpath, Appletree Bottom
images.caption: Wooded footpath, Appletree Bottom. One of the many footpaths that wind their way around Goodwood Country Park.

images.title: Simon Carey / Hat Hill
images.caption: Hat Hill. The wood opposite is called Ladys Winkins the name believed to derive from the Saxon for an irregular shaped wood. Halnaker Hill is in the background its windmill can just be made out. Taken from New Barn Hill, the road from Pilleygreen Lodges to Waterbeech.

description: Explore the Goodwood estate in Chichester, West Sussex on this circular walk. There's miles of nice woodland trails and some moderate hill climbs with splendid views over the South Downs, Chichester, the Isle of Wight and the famous Goodwood Racecourse. You can extend your walk by following the Monarch's Way to the nearby Eartham Woods and Slindon Estate where there are miles of cyling and walking trails to try. You can also climb to The Trundle Iron Age Hillfort for great views over the racecourse. Our West Dean to East Dean Walk takes you between the two villages, via the fort.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south east of the estate you'll find the Halnaker Windmill. The old mill is a picturesque place to visit with its wildflower rich chalk grassland and fine views. Head west from the park and you could pick up the Centurion Way. This easy shared cycling and walking trail runs along the old Midhurst and Chichester railway track from Chichester to West Dean.

display_address: Goodwood Country Park - Counter's Gate, Racecourse Road, East Dean, Chichester, West Sussex, England, PO18 0QE, United Kingdom
